page.title: 12Home Life around Beeley Moor
page.content: Of the thirty inhabitants living in the ten dwelings located within this area, seven families are dependent on farming for their livelihood, one family run a boarding kennels and the two other dwellings are private homes. Of the inhabitants only two are senior citizens, eight are school children and twenty are gainfully employed. The two groups of habitations are fairly isolated, being two to four miles from the nearest villages: Ashover and Holymoorside. They are not served by public transport and rely on private cars for their mobility. The farms and cottages in this area are all sturdily built in local stone and some have been renovated and moderised, preserving the exterior appearance of the original buildings. Farm buildings in some cases being considerably older than the farm house.
